  • Method Details

    • cipherPrincipal

      public void cipherPrincipal(String path, String pNameFile, int mode)
      Method for encrypting or decrypting a textfile using the AES block cipher algorithm. The PaddedBufferedBlockCipher outputs a block only when the buffer is full and more data is being added, or on a doFinal (unless the current block in the buffer is a pad block). The default padding mechanism used is PKCS5/PKCS7. pots consultar els enllaços.
      Specified by:
      cipherPrincipal in interface CipherFacade
      Parameters:
      path - Ruta del fitxer
      pNameFile - Nom del fitxer
      mode - Mode de la funció 1->encriptar 2->desencriptar
      See Also:
      • tutorialspoint.com – Advanced encryption standard
      • ibm.com – PKCS padding method

    • encriptFile

      public void encriptFile(String path, String pNameFile)
      Method for encrypting a text file
      Parameters:
      path - File location path
      pNameFile - File name

    • decripFileProperties

      public List<String> decripFileProperties(String path, String pNameFile)
      Method for decrypting a file using the AES block cipher algorithm and returning the decrypted content. The PaddedBufferedBlockCipher outputs a block only when the buffer is full and more data is being added, or on a doFinal (unless the current block in the buffer is a pad block). The default padding mechanism used is the one outlined in PKCS5/PKCS7.
      Specified by:
      decripFileProperties in interface CipherFacade
      Parameters:
      path - File location path
      pNameFile - File name
      Returns:
      List[] - List of strings where each element is a decrypted block of the text file.
